name: Swayambhunath Stupa
description: Swayambhunath, also known as the Monkey Temple, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site that offers a panoramic view of Kathmandu valley.

name: Boudhanath Stupa
description: Boudhanath Stupa is one of the largest stupas in Nepal and an important religious site for Buddhists.

name: Kathmandu Durbar Square
description: Kathmandu Durbar Square is a historic palace complex with ancient temples, courtyards, and the Kumari Ghar, the residence of the living goddess.

name: Pashupatinath Temple
description: Pashupatinath Temple is one of the holiest Hindu temples in the world, dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is located on the banks of the Bagmati River.

name: Thamel
description: Thamel is a popular tourist district in Kathmandu known for its vibrant streets, shops, restaurants, and nightlife.

name: Garden of Dreams
description: The Garden of Dreams is a neo-classical garden in the heart of Kathmandu, offering a peaceful escape from the city hustle and bustle.

name: Bhaktapur Durbar Square
description: Bhaktapur Durbar Square is a UNESCO World Heritage Site with well-preserved ancient architecture and a rich cultural heritage.

name: Hanuman Dhoka
description: Hanuman Dhoka Durbar Square is another historic palace complex with artistic temples and statues.

name: Nagarkot
description: Nagarkot is a hill station near Kathmandu known for its stunning sunrise and sunset views of the Himalayas.

name: Kopan Monastery
description: Kopan Monastery is a Tibetan Buddhist monastery located on the outskirts of Kathmandu, offering meditation and retreats.
